docs.snippet: Silicon Valley usually focuses on a long-term future. Now it’s starting to care about what happens on Nov. 8. That’s not easy.

headline.main: Daily Report: Reluctantly, Tech Notices the Election

docs.snippet: The company has become an indispensable news source for millions but as a business, it needs a white knight to swoop in.

headline.print_headline: Twitter Has an Old Media Problem. Here’s a Solution.
headline.main: Twitter Has an Old Media Problem. Here’s a Solution.

docs.snippet: Photos of a man pushing a shopping cart with a girl’s hair wrapped around its handle set off a discussion about bystanders intervening in the parenting of others.

headline.main: Should You Intervene When a Parent Harshly Disciplines a Child in Public?

docs.snippet: A security researcher says hackers are offering records of more than 1 billion users, but as with the company’s stock, the price is dropping.

headline.print_headline: For Sale on the Dark Web: Yahoo Users’ Stolen Records
headline.main: Hacked Yahoo Data Is for Sale on Dark Web

docs.abstract: Cybersecurity firm InfoArmor reports that records of more than 1 billion Yahoo email users are being sold on dark web, saying complete copies have already been purchased by three buyers who each paid $300,000; data from August 2013 hacking includes names, birth dates, phone numbers, passwords, security questions and backup email addresses.

docs.snippet: Shares of Harman International soared after the company agreed to be acquired by Samsung Electronics.

headline.main: Wall St. Closes Mixed as Interest Rates Tick Up

docs.snippet: Donald Trump has added 10 names to the list he says he'd use to fill Supreme Court vacancies if he becomes president, including a U.S. senator whose inclusion helped secure a bitter rival's endorsement.

headline.print_headline: Trump Adds Names to Supreme Court Wish List
headline.main: Trump Adds Names to Supreme Court Wish List

docs.snippet: New York City kicked off a social media advertising campaign on Monday to combat negative perceptions of Muslims and counteract  increasing instances of threats and violence, officials said.

headline.print_headline: New York Launches Ad Campaign to Fight Anti-Muslim Rhetoric, Violence
headline.main: New York Launches Ad Campaign to Fight Anti-Muslim Rhetoric, Violence

docs.snippet: Asian shares recovered and the Mexican peso surged on Tuesday as  investors seemed to award the first U.S. presidential debate to  Democrat Hillary Clinton over Republican Donald Trump.

headline.print_headline: Asia Stocks, Mexico Peso Bounce as Markets See Clinton as Winner of Debate
headline.main: Asia Stocks, Mexico Peso Bounce as Markets See Clinton as Winner of Debate

docs.snippet: Donald Trump says he's "greatly honored" to receive the endorsement of defeated rival Ted Cruz, not that Cruz is using that word when acknowledging that he will vote for the Republican presidential nominee.

headline.print_headline: Cruz Throws His Support to Trump's Campaign at Last
headline.main: Cruz Throws His Support to Trump's Campaign at Last

docs.snippet: Àlex Ollé brings an avant-garde sensibility to “The Flying Dutchman,” which he set in Bangladesh instead of Norway. The production opens in Madrid on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: From street theater to the opera stage
headline.main: From Street Theater to Wagner on the Opera Stage
